Commentary: Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run, full and outside off, flashes a drive and sends an outside edge to third man
Hasan Ali to Rafatullah Mohmand, no run, good length ball on off, quietly played back to the bowler on the front foot
Hasan Ali to Rafatullah Mohmand, no run, Hasan finds swing and beats the outside edge lavishly. Full, starts outside off, and shapes away. Lovely ball. Rafatullah drives away from the body and misses
Hasan Ali to Rafatullah Mohmand, 1 run, length ball on off, Rafatullah plays a jabbing punch to mid-off
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run, Hasan punches his fist in annoyance. Full in the channel, hunts for the outside edge with awayswing. Smith fishes away from the body and gets away
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run, back of a length and on off, punchily played back to the bowler
Junaid Khan to Rafatullah Mohmand, no run, fractionally short on off, Rafatullah swings his hands at a pull. Ends up dragging the ball to midwicket
Junaid Khan to Rafatullah Mohmand, SIX, chest-high short ball on middle and leg, Junaid beats Rafatullah for pace and bounce. He top-edges a hook, off the front foot, which flies over long leg
Junaid Khan to Rafatullah Mohmand, FOUR, length ball angling away outside off, clears his front leg and smears the ball over mid-on who is inside the circle
Junaid Khan to Rafatullah Mohmand, no run, length and angling across off, gets forward and pushes the ball to cover-point. The off-side ring is well populated

Junaid Khan to Rafatullah Mohmand, OUT, nicked behind. Good length and angling away outside off, kicks up from a length. Rafatullah slashes away from the body and is surprised by the extra bounce. He edges it behind with the keeper completing a regulation catch
Wicket: ['Rafatullah Mohmand c †Kamran Akmal b Junaid Khan 11 (8b 1x4 1x6) SR: 137.50']

Commentary: Junaid Khan to Haddin, 1 run, fuller ball, angling away outside off, closes the face of his bat as he pushes off the front foot and they take off for the single though the ball has gone straight to mid-on. Complete it fairly easily in the end
Hasan Ali to Haddin, no run, superb delivery. On a length, in the corridor and nipping back in late. Haddin sticks his bat out and gets duly beaten
Hasan Ali to Haddin, 1 run, short of a length outside off, opens his bat face and drops it in front of third man
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run, short of a length outside off, punched crisply off the backfoot but straight to covers
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run, gets some bounce as it skids through from short of a length and Smith tries to force it through the off side but does not find the middle of his bat
Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run, fuller ball, clipped away off the pads wide of mid-on

Hasan Ali to Haddin, OUT, that's a superb delivery. Cuts back in from the short of a length region and Haddin is looking to tuck it away off the pads into the leg side. It keeps a tad low and he gets rapped on the pads and the umpire's finger goes up almost straightaway. What a start for Peshawar. Islamabad are 15 for 2 after three overs. This is exactly what Peshawar needed defending a low total
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, 1 run, worked into the leg side for a single
Wicket: ['BJ Haddin lbw b Hasan Ali 2 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00']

Commentary: Shakib Al Hasan to Billings, no run, tucked away to midwicket
Shakib Al Hasan to Billings, 1 run, fuller ball, comes forward and clips this through to midwicket
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, 1 run
Shakib Al Hasan to Billings, no run, fires it full and on the pads, slides in with the angle and it is pushed to the right of the bowler
Shakib Al Hasan to Billings, no run, presses forward to defend this fuller ball and gets an inside edge on to the pads. Optimistic appeal for leg before but turned down
Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run, length ball, cutting back in, stays inside the line of the ball and works it away wide of long-on

Hasan Ali to Billings, no run, gets a good, positive stride forward to meet this length and stabs it into the off side and thinks of the single but the bowler runs across on the follow-through to gather it and they decide against it
Hasan Ali to Billings, 1 run, has to reach out to this wide delivery outside off and carves it to third man with an open bat face
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run, short of a length, holding its line outside off this time and Smith punches solidly off the backfoot towards mid-off

Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run, length ball, skidding through and cutting back in again and Smith manages to tucks it away into the leg side off the pads. Did he get an inside edge on to the pads there? He did as the bowler goes up in a stifled appeal but no problems there
Hasan Ali to Billings, no run, fullish length ball outside off, comes forward and blocks and drills it hard into the turf as the ball goes behind the stumps, towards the wicketkeeper after it bounces
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, short of a length and slanting away from the right-hander from over the wicket and it is slapped to point
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run, this one comes on fuller and straighter and on leg stump channel and it is tucked away off the pads to the on side
Wahab Riaz to Billings, 1 run, length ball, angling away on off, comes forward and drops it in front of the covers region for a quick single
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, short of a length ball, stays in the crease and nudges it to the leg side

Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, cramps him for room by bowling it on off. It's back of a length but Smith can only tap it to the off side off the backfoot. This is good bowling. Can he make Smith try to force something here?
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, good length ball to end the over. Defended back to the bowler
Shakib Al Hasan to Billings, 1 run, comes down the track to meet the pitch of this ball and uses the inward angle to clip it away to between midwicket and long-on
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, 1 run, tries to slap it through the off side and chops it towards long-off
Shakib Al Hasan to Billings, 1 run, strides forward to meet the pitch of the ball and drops it in front of the cover-point region
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, no run, backs away and tries to hammer this one away through the off side but can only work it back to the bowler. Smith is struggling here

Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, SIX, Shakib does well to toss it up and gets it to turn away but Smith brings in the long handle as he reaches out for it and carves it straight down the ground, for a clean six. That was just power that saved him there. Shakib won't be too discouraged by that
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, no run, skews it off the splice to the covers region
Shahid Afridi to Billings, 1 run, comes down the track and clips it away to midwicket

Shahid Afridi to Smith, 1 run, stays in the crease and tries to whip this through the leg side but does not middle it and the ball goes towards the short leg fielder. Smith is slow off the blocks and the keeper gathers it and fires a throw. Direct hit at the non-striker's end would have seen the back of him
Shahid Afridi to Billings, 1 run, worked away to deep midwicket
Shahid Afridi to Smith, no run, stays back and looks to work this through the off side but the ball spins the other way as it's the googly and takes the inside edge of Smith's blade

Shahid Afridi to Smith, SIX, long handle again, that's another pressure-releasing shot. Afridi floats up a length ball and offers up a lot of width outside off and Smith has all the time in the world to get down on one knee and slog it long and hard over deep midwicket
Shahid Afridi to Smith, no run
Wahab Riaz to Billings, no run, tries to make room and carve this short of a length ball through the off side but cannot beat backward point
Wahab Riaz to Billings, FOUR, advances down the ground to meet the pitch of this ball, converts it into a fuller ball and crunches it through extra cover. Top shot
Wahab Riaz to Billings, no run, length ball, shaping away outside off and jags away late, beats the outside edge of the batsman who tries to run it down to third man with an open bat face

Wahab Riaz to Billings, OUT, comes down the track and looks to carve this short of a length ball through the off side but he gets an inside edge and chops it on to the stumps. Peshawar have every reason to believe that they can defend this total. The bowler dragged the pace back there and that did the trick
Wahab Riaz to Misbah-ul-Haq, no run, jags away outside off and it is left alone
Wahab Riaz to Misbah-ul-Haq, no run, comes forward and reaches out to this wide ball and knocks it to the right of point who slides across to get his hands to it
Shahid Afridi to Smith, no run, defended back to the bowler
Shahid Afridi to Smith, 1 run
Shahid Afridi to Misbah-ul-Haq, 1 run, width on offer outside off and Misbah slaps hard as the ball goes to the deep point boundary, it is cut off before the fence by the fielder running to his left

Shahid Afridi to Smith, 1 run, shorter in length and it is slapped off the backfoot past the bowler. Afridi sticks his hand out but that was travelling and Hasan Ali runs across, slides and stops it away before getting up and flicking it back to Jordan. Good team effort
Shahid Afridi to Misbah-ul-Haq, no run, shorter in length, cut to backward point

Shahid Afridi to Misbah-ul-Haq, no run, length ball, Misbah blocks from the crease and Afridi almost leaps up in celebration as the ball nearly takes out the stumps off the pads. He got a thickish inside edge

Junaid Khan to Smith, FOUR, length ball that is angled away and there is just enough room for Smith who stays leg side of the ball and absolutelu pummels it with a half-angled bat past mid-off who starts to his right but has no chance to get to it
Junaid Khan to Smith, no run, full toss, misses out as he tries to drag it away into the leg side and closes the face of his bat. Went too hard at it and messed up the timing

Junaid Khan to Smith, SIX, slightly slower and on a fullish length outside off. It is going away from him but Smith once again opts to heave it over the leg side. Does not find the middle of the bat but still decent enough connection as the ball goes to the cow corner boundary
Junaid Khan to Smith, FOUR, that's just brute force. Half-volley outside off and Smith puts the right foot across while making sure he gives himself enough room before crashing it through extra cover
Junaid Khan to Smith, no run, slower short ball, gets up and tries to flay it through the off side but goes through with the shot early and gets beaten by the lack of pace
Junaid Khan to Smith, no run, knocks it back towards the bowler off the backfoot
Shahid Afridi to Misbah-ul-Haq, 1 run, short of a length and spinning away, worked off the backfoot into the gap, wide of long-on
Shahid Afridi to Smith, 1 run, back of a length, whipped off the backfoot between deep midwicket and long-on
Shahid Afridi to Misbah-ul-Haq, 1 run, tosses it up generously outside off and it is driven crisply to wide long-off

Shahid Afridi to Smith, 1 run, back of a length and it is whipped off the backfoot very hard back to the bowler. Was that a chance! Yes, it was. That was flat-batted with immense power and Afridi barely had time to react to it. Gets his fingers to it but cannot hold on to the ball. Unfair to call that a dropped catch
Shahid Afridi to Misbah-ul-Haq, 1 run
Shahid Afridi to Smith, FOUR, short ball, stays in the crease before pulling it away deep midwicket and the ball screams into the deep midwicket boundary
Shakib Al Hasan to Misbah-ul-Haq, no run, sliding in with the arm on a fullish length, blocked off the front foot back to the bowler
Shakib Al Hasan to Misbah-ul-Haq, no run, advances down the track but the bowler drags his length back and Misbah knocks it back to Shakib
Shakib Al Hasan to Misbah-ul-Haq, 1 run, short of a length, not much turn, whipped away off the backfoot wide of long-on
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, 1 run, length ball on leg stump, not much bounce, tucked away off the pads through the leg side

Shakib Al Hasan to Misbah-ul-Haq, OUT, Misbah falters on the pull shot. Not a great delivery. Short and he swivels around with the pull but does not time it too well. Sends it straight into the hands of Wahab Riaz at deep midwicket. That maybe didn't sit up as well as he would have liked. And he got it off the toe end of the bat
Shakib Al Hasan to Watson, 1 run, slightly short of good length, Watson backs before punching it against the angle to long-off
Shahid Afridi to Watson, no run, length ball, stays a tad low outside off and he gets an inside edge that goes back to the right of Afridi
Shahid Afridi to Watson, no run, yorks him with a quicker ball on the stumps and it is dug out back to the bowler
Wicket: ['Misbah-ul-Haq c Wahab Riaz b Shakib Al Hasan 5 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 41.66']

Commentary: Shahid Afridi to Watson, 1 run, shorter in length and a little bit of width on offer, slapped out to sweeper cover

Shahid Afridi to Smith, FOUR, missed chance in front of the straight boundary. Smith lofts this length ball down the ground but does not get the elevation desired. Hasan Ali runs across to his left from long-on but he has over-run the ball and to is horror, watches it cross the boundary after landing in front of it. How costly will that lapse prove?

Shahid Afridi to Smith, no run, appeal for caught behind, not given. That was gone, there was an edge but the umpire didn't think so. Smith was looking to open the bat face from too close to the body and gets an outside edge. Kamran Akmal has taken a sharp catch behind the stumps. Afridi was late in appealing and Peshawar are denied a wicket
Shahid Afridi to Smith, no run
Shakib Al Hasan to Watson, 1 run, worked down to long-on
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, 1 run, tossed up delivery, eased down to long-on off the front foot

Shakib Al Hasan to Watson, FOUR, short and some width on offer outside off. Watson cuts hard off the back foot and the ball goes through extra cover where the fielder makes a mess of it and lets the ball go from through his legs as he dives
Shakib Al Hasan to Watson, 1 run, good length ball from Shakib, Watson punches it off the backfoot through covers
Shakib Al Hasan to Smith, 1 run, short of a length and wide outside off, punched off the backfoot through the covers region. And that's the fifty for Smith. Can he finish the job for his team?
Shakib Al Hasan to Watson, 1 run, whipped away down the ground off the backfoot. Time for the timeout
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 run, short of a length and angling away outside off, drops it into the off side after riding the bounce and they take the single as point comes running in
Wahab Riaz to Smith, FOUR, full and wide outside off, enough width on offer and Smith pummels it straight over the bowler's head for a straight as an arrow boundary

Wahab Riaz to Smith, FOUR, short of good length and it is just nonchalantly flicked off the pads, gets it wide of the fielder at square leg and the ball goes through the deep backward square leg boundary. Can't be bowling there at this stage to a set batsman
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, starts to take a step forward and Wahab smartly drags the length back and fires a bouncer outside off and Smith is forced to let it go

Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, starts to take a step forward again and Wahab bangs it in and Smith backs away before fending it off and dropping it into the off side with a flat bat. Good contest between bat and ball going on
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run, very full ball outside off, dug out to extra cover for a quick single

Junaid Khan to Smith, 1 run, full toss again, very nearly another no-ball. Smith tries to go big over the leg side but cannot get hold of the shot as he flat-bats it into the hands of long-on. Does not matter. The catch does not count
Junaid Khan to Watson, 1 run, goes for a wide yorker again but this is a low full toss outside off and is worked away to third man. Smith back on strike
Junaid Khan to Smith, 1 run, still can't get the yorker right, low full toss, angling in, drilled away to long-off

Junaid Khan to Watson, no run, he is restlessly awitching angles but just cannot get the yorker right. Low and wide full toss and he is lucky that the batsman found the bottom end of the bat or it would have been a wide

Junaid Khan to Watson, SIX, make that another attempted yorker gone wrong. Full toss and lot of width and you can't get away with those at this stage of a chase. Watson flays it clean over long-off. Tamim Iqbal can only watch it go to the boundary. This is turning into a nightmarish over for Junaid and Peshawar

Junaid Khan to Watson, SIX, that's a humongous hit. That one lands on the roof. Watson has laid into a pull shot. Short ball from over the stumps and sits up nicely. Watson was probably expecting a short ball to be around the corner after all the attempted yorkers gone wrong. That's a mighty pull shot, played with authority. On the roof and will stay there
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, yorker on leg stump, tries to flick but is late in bringing the bat down and wears it on the pad
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, slower ball bouncer, Smith gets under it and the umpire thinks the height is fine there
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run, fuller ball, jams the bat down and runs it down to long-off
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 run, fuller ball, hammered to extra cover
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run, slower ball, short of a length, rolls his fingers over that one and Smith is through with the pull shot early
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run, short of a length outside off, slaps with a flat bat to the extra cover region and cover runs across and slides to field it. Well-done

Hasan Ali to Smith, SIX, Darren Sammy's six foot five frame can't get to that at the long-off boundary. Great effort as he leaps up and gets a fingertip to it but even he could not get to it as the ball clips the fingers and sails over the boundary. Full and in the slot and it is hammered over mid-off
Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run, opens the bat face and steers it wide of backward point
Hasan Ali to Watson, 1 run, low full toss outside off, pushed off the front foot to long-off
Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run, fuller ball, pushed back to the bowler and Watson is outside the crease, looking for a run. Hasan throws and misses
Hasan Ali to Watson, no run, yorker outside off, very nicely bowled, gets an outside edge that dos not carry to the keeper
Hasan Ali to Watson, 1 run, low full toss, drilled through the covers region
Junaid Khan to Watson, 1 run, fuller ball on the stumps, turned away to midwicket for a single. Singles will do it for Islamabad. Five off five now
Junaid Khan to Smith, 1 run, bangs it in from around the wicket and Smith tries to duck but wears it on the elbow as the ball runs away into the leg side

Junaid Khan to Watson, 2 runs, Watson hammers this to sweeper cover and Smith comes charging back for the second. The throw comes on at the bowler's end and Junaid does not collect the ball. Had he gathered it, the batsman would have been out by a mile
Junaid Khan to Watson, no run, slower ball on leg stump, does not bounce and hits Watson on the pad

Junaid Khan to Watson, 1 run, OUT, there is a review for a run out and Watson is short of his ground. He is gone and the crowd has found its voice again. Islamabad looking to finish it off with one ball to spare but Kamran Akmal gathers the ball and whips the bails off to make sure that does not happen. Worked it with a flat bat to long-on and came charging back for the second
Junaid Khan to Amad Butt, 1 run, Junaid gets the yorker wrong and bowls a low full toss. Amad drills it past the diving mid-on fielder to take the single and pumps the air in delight. What a match
